summary: Did you play any of the "Mystery Dongeon" serie ?
question: Did you play any of the "Mystery Dongeon" serie ?
answer: I did, actually! Explorers of the Sky was my first Pokémon game (even though I technically still haven’t beaten it), and I also have Super Mystery Dungeon (which I also still haven’t beaten yet). They’re really great games, and the soundtracks are so good I could go on for days about them.

reblog.comment: I did, actually! Explorers of the Sky was my first Pokémon game (even though I technically still haven’t beaten it), and I also have Super Mystery Dungeon (which I also still haven’t beaten yet). They’re really great games, and the soundtracks are so good I could go on for days about them.

trail.content_raw: I did, actually! Explorers of the Sky was my first Pokémon game (even though I technically still haven’t beaten it), and I also have Super Mystery Dungeon (which I also still haven’t beaten yet). They’re really great games, and the soundtracks are so good I could go on for days about them.
trail.content: I did, actually! Explorers of the Sky was my first Pokémon game (even though I technically still haven’t beaten it), and I also have Super Mystery Dungeon (which I also still haven’t beaten yet). They’re really great games, and the soundtracks are so good I could go on for days about them.

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1492: Klinklang (Black & White)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1492: Klinklang (Black & White)
body:
Klinklang was the latest in a line of Pokemon that moved a certain type of Energy around its side of play at will. Klinklang, unsurprisingly, did this for Metal Energy, and it followed that Metal- and Colorless-type attackers went well with this. And, indeed, they did. And then came things like Mewtwo EX and Blend Energy WLFM and Prism Energy came around and Klinklang was the obvious choice to build a toolbox deck around. Hitting big Weaknesses was always an interesting sort of deck, but the question remained if that could still work in a format filled with so many big options with their own sorts of support.

140 HP was a good start. It was actually high enough to take hits even from the likes of Zekrom. Even Kyurem from Plasma Freeze needed multiple Deoxys EX. The Fire Weakness did cause Reshiram problems, holding Klinklang back early in the HGSS-On format, but Reshiram fell off over time and that opened things up a bit more. The Psychic Resistance was pretty nice for Mewtwo EX. That Retreat Cost of 3 was pretty nasty, and with it along with the tendency to pair this with attackers that also struggled to retreat meant that all the typical help was needed here.

Shift Gear was a fantastic Ability. You could move Metal Energy around your Pokemon as much as you wanted during your turn. This did indeed work with Special Energy that could be Metal at all, which let a ton of Pokemon EX pair up here. Even those not able to use Blend Energy, like Darkrai EX, could work with Prism Energy and the fact that it helped anything also with Prism Energy to Retreat. While such decks with the likes of Cobalion and its EX, Tornadus EX, Darkrai EX, and even things like Kyogre EX and Groudon EX, weren’t quite at the top, they were very noteworthy and had some pretty good results.

Klinklang did fall off for a while early in the BLW-On format, but its Shift Gear got one more chance with the release of another Klinklang in Plasma Storm. That Klinklang prevented Pokemon-EX from damaging your Metal-type Pokemon. The pairing of both Klinklang with Cobalion EX was quite powerful, especially since the popular Kyurem from Plasma Freeze had a Metal Weakness. This brought Klinklang back to just below the top tier, and having Keldeo EX to help with its retreating issues didn’t hurt either.

Klinklang had an attack of its own. Gear Grind required a Metal and 2 Colorless Energy for 2 coin flips. Each heads did 80 damage. The average of 80 was quite respectable, and the 25% chance for 160 was fantastic, but you weren’t going to use any attack that did nothing a quarter of the time very often. Klinklang was only unreliable backup to better attackers at best.

Klinklang, along with all of the Special Energy that could work as Metal and other things at the same time, could provide flexibility to use a wide range of attackers to target whatever Pokemon were popular at the time. The reliance on finding the right Pokemon at the right time prevented Klinklang from being the best available deck, but at least it had things like Heavy Ball to help it along. The combination resulted in something that was seen in tournaments reasonably often for a deck with a Stage 2 as support in an era of a ton of decks relying exclusively on Basic Pokemon.

question: Fav legendary Pokemon ?
answer:
There are so many good choices, this is a tough one! I think I have to say Reshiram on this one, purely for the nostalgia since Black was one of my first main series games.

Runner-ups include Virizion, Mespirit, Cresselia, Latias, and Xerneas!

reblog.comment:

Runner-ups include Virizion, Mespirit, Cresselia, Latias, and Xerneas!

blog.name: fawninthewinter
blog.title: 🌙Fly Me to the Moon and Past the Stars 🌟
blog.description: Kat/Kitkat|21|She/Her|Autistic|Bi|ENFP|🇨🇦|♐|Hello people of Tumblr, and welcome to my blog. It is a multi fandom blog, but you will mostly see a shit ton of Gravity falls, Steven Universe, Disney, various anime, Kingdom Hearts, Undertale, Pokemon, Digimon, Sonic the Hedgehog and of course shitposts. I mean, who doesn't enjoy those? If there is anything anyone needs tagged, don't be afraid to message or send me an ask asking me to tag it. I happily will.

title: Icon Commissions Open!!
body:
Hey hey hey! Now that I’m back in the groove I think it’s time I open commissions! This time it’s icons!

They’re going for $15 a pop, keep in mind that this is a full-scale headshot piece of a relatively high resolution. It will be compressed and edited to better fit whatever social media platform you’re using it for at your request!

Examples: 

I have 10 slots open!! Get ‘em while they’re hot!!

title: Archeops - 567

- Pokemon White
